text: Jarrick Hillery (born March 29, 1976) is a former American football wide receiver who played eight seasons in the Arena Football League with the Nashville Kats, Georgia Force and Carolina Cobras. He played college football at Tennessee State University. ==College career== Hillery played college football for the Tennessee State Tigers. He was a First Team All-Ohio Valley Conference selection his senior year and helped the Tigers to a conference title in 1998. He was also named OVC Specialist of the Week twice his senior year. ==Professional career== ===Nashville Kats=== Hillery played for the Nashville Kats from 2000 to 2001, earning First Team All-Arena in 2001. ===Georgia Force=== Hillery played for the Georgia Force from 2002 to 2003. ===Carolina Cobras=== Hillery signed with the Carolina Cobras on October 29, 2003. He played for the team during the 2004 season. ===Nashville Kats=== Hillery was signed by the Nashville Kats on October 11, 2004. He played for the Kats from 2005 to 2006. ===Georgia Force=== Hillery signed with the Georgia Force on January 19, 2007. He played for the Force during the 2007 season. ==References== ==External links== *Just Sports Stats Category:Living people Category:1976 births Category:Players of American football from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:American football wide receivers Category:American football defensive backs Category:African-American players of American football Category:Tennessee State Tigers football players Category:Nashville Kats players Category:Georgia Force players Category:Carolina Cobras players Category:People from Brunswick, Georgia
title: Jarrick Hillery
